metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5018 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Apache Tomcat 9.0.0.M1 to 9.0.0.M9, 8.5.0 to 8.5.4, 8.0.0.RC1 to 8.0.36,7.0.0 to 7.0.70 and 6.0.0 to 6.0.45 a malicious web application was able tobypass a configured SecurityManager via a Tomcat utility method that wasaccessible to web applications.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5018` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.45+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libservlet3.1-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
libtomcat8-java - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8 - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-admin - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-common - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-examples - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
tomcat8-user - 8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat7 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.68-1ubuntu0.3').
tomcat6 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.45+dfsg-1').
tomcat8 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8.0.32-1ubuntu1.3').
